abstract: Reports the failed execution of the action.
overview:
## Discussion

Calling this method sets the [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXAction/isComplete] property value to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true]. Calling this method more than once or calling it after calling the [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXAction/fulfill()] method has no effect.

It’s safe to call `fail()` asynchronously. For example, call it in [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXProviderDelegate] callback method implementations as shown in the following code snippet from the [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/making-and-receiving-voip-calls] sample code project:

items.description: Reports the successful execution of the action.
items.name: fulfill()

title: fail()
